MIPS_Multi
Class Memory

java.lang.Object
  MIPS_Multi.Memory

public class Memory
extends java.lang.Object

Provides read/write access to main memory. All addresses are byte addresses, but all values are 32-bit words. Only words that have been written to can be read.

Constructor Summary
Memory()

static void dumpAll()
          Prints a formatted dump of all initialized memory locations on System.out.

Constructor Detail

Memory

public Memory()
Method Detail

memRead

public static int memRead(int byteAddress)
Returns a word of memory. Converts byteAddress to a word address.

Parameters:
byteAddress - Byte address of the word to be read. The rightmost two bits are discarded.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - if the word being read has not been written to.

memWrite

public static void memWrite(int byteAddress,
                            int data)
Stores a word of memory. Converts byteAddress to a word address.

Parameters:
byteAddress - Byte address where the word will be stored. The rightmost two bits are discarded.
data - The data word that is stored.

memInit

public static void memInit()
Reinitializes memory. Use this method if you want to clear the contents before loading a second program.

dumpAll

public static void dumpAll()
                    throws java.io.IOException
Prints a formatted dump of all initialized memory locations on System.out. If there are more than 100 word of memory to dump, for confirmation before proceeding.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - If there is an error reading from the console.
